meanings.definition: Xenophobias: intense or irrational dislike or fear of people from other countries
meanings.sent1: Her xenophobias made it difficult for her to interact with foreign students at school.
meanings.sent2: His xenophobias were evident when he refused to try any cuisine from other countries.
meanings.sent3: Despite his xenophobias, he couldn't resist the allure of a delicious foreign dish.
meanings.sent4: The xenophobias in his mind built walls that kept him isolated from the world.
meanings.sent5: The xenophobias lurking within her were like shadows, always present but never seen clearly.

meanings.definition: Xenophobias: a person who exhibits intense or irrational dislike or fear of people from other countries
meanings.sent1: She avoided the xenophobias in her community who refused to welcome newcomers.
meanings.sent2: The xenophobias at the meeting made derogatory comments about immigrants.
meanings.sent3: The xenophobias in the office always had a scowl on his face when speaking to foreigners.
meanings.sent4: He was a xenophobias, a person who built walls instead of bridges with those from other countries.
meanings.sent5: The xenophobias stood alone, isolated by their own unfounded fears of the unfamiliar.
